item.title: Moralist Therapeutic Deism offers no hope for the future.It offers no redemption from the past.And it offers no peace for the present.
item.description:
Moralist Therapeutic Deism offers no hope for the future.It offers no redemption from the past.And it offers no peace for the present.

People have an innate understanding there is something wrong with the world. Turn on the TV in any country and you are likely to see a deluge of hysteria stemming from systematic problems that are innately human. Humanity has a sin problem...which leads to an evil problem which leads to a death problem... Get the picture?

item.title: No title
item.description: Victims of terrorism are those, who out of fear, stop loving their neighbor. #lovethyneighbor

item.title: No title
item.description: The Supreme Court made a landmark decision this week about gay marriage (and Obama Care). They answered a question that has divided our country for a very long time. Though SCOTUS answered one big question, they only served to spawn many others and unearthed some old ones along the way. I know how divisive this issue is among Christians. But if we miss the people amid the situation, we miss seeing Jesus. Here’s the thing about Jesus, He always saw the people: the hurting, the broken, the proud, the religious, the marginalized, and He dug past the surface issues to hit upon the deeper questions. There are deeper questions at play here. Here is one of them.
